question: Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change (MoEFCC) has recently launched the “Blue Flag” programme to:
option1: conduct tiger census in Tiger range countries (TRCs)
option3: reduce the level of groundwater pollution in the country
explanation: Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change has launched the Blue Flag programme to certify clean beaches in India. The blue flag criteria have been set by Foundation for Environmental Education. It requires the beach should not be affected by industrial, waste-water, or sewage discharge and water must be clean. It also specifies that algae vegetation or natural debris should not be left on the beach, waste disposal bins must be available along the beach in adequate numbers and toilets along the beach should have controlled sewage disposal for beaches to be granted Blue Flag certification.
